description: Phase 1: Frontend foundation - React app with routing, auth flow, and inventory creation

userStories.title: Frontend project scaffolding
userStories.description: Set up the React frontend with Vite, Bun, and core dependencies
acceptanceCriteria: Create frontend/ directory with Vite React TypeScript template
Install dependencies: react-router-dom, @tanstack/react-query, zustand, axios, tailwindcss, lucide-react
Configure Tailwind CSS with mobile-first breakpoints
Create basic App.tsx with React Router setup
Add scripts to package.json: dev, build, typecheck, lint
Run `bun install` and `bun run dev` successfully
userStories.notes: Use Bun for package management. TypeScript strict mode.

userStories.title: App layout and routing
userStories.description: Create the base layout shell and route structure
acceptanceCriteria: Create src/components/layout/AppLayout.tsx with header and main content area
Create src/pages/Home.tsx placeholder
Create src/pages/Inventory.tsx placeholder
Create src/pages/NotFound.tsx
Set up routes: / (home), /:slug (inventory), /* (404)
Mobile-responsive header with app title
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: API client setup
userStories.description: Configure Axios client and TanStack Query provider
acceptanceCriteria: Create src/api/client.ts with Axios instance
Base URL configurable via env var (VITE_API_URL)
Request interceptor to add X-Passphrase header from store
Response interceptor for 401 handling
Wrap App in QueryClientProvider
Typecheck passes

State: sessions Map of slug â†’ passphrase (for multi-inventory support)

userStories.title: Home page with create inventory form
userStories.description: Build the landing page where users create new inventories
acceptanceCriteria: Hero section with app title and brief description
Create Inventory form: party name, passphrase (with confirm), optional description
Form validation (name required, passphrase min 6 chars, passwords match)
Submit button calls API (mock for now if backend not ready)
On success, redirect to /:slug
Mobile-friendly form layout
Typecheck passes

acceptanceCriteria: Section on Home page: 'Access Existing Inventory'
Input for slug (or parse from URL if navigating directly)
Passphrase input with show/hide toggle
Submit validates against API (mock if needed)
On success: store session, redirect to /:slug
